title.rendered: 16 Best Things to Do in North Hollywood

content.rendered:
North Hollywood is a vibrant neighborhood that is always buzzing with activity, and you will find an abundance of entertainment centers, city attractions, restaurants and festivals here. Keep reading to find out some of the best things you can do in North Hollywood, whether you’re a local or a tourist.

❗️Follow all COVID-19 precautions!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In North Hollywood, Los Angeles

Enjoy the outdoors at some of the best North Hollywood attractions

1. Check out the Elephants of Asia exhibit

If you’re planning to go to Los Angeles Zoo on your trip, you can’t miss the elephant exhibit – literally! It’s the largest in the zoo’s history. It boasts more than three acres of outdoor space, deep bathing pools, a waterfall, sandy hills, clever enrichment opportunities, and a high-tech barn capable of caring for elephants of all sizes and ages. Stop and watch a while to learn more about these incredible and highly intelligent animals.

WEBSITE
TICKETS

2. Universal Studios Hollywood

A film studio and theme park, Universal Studios Hollywood is a hot spot in Los Angeles. It’s one of the best places to visit in North Hollywood for variety – enjoy themed rides, shop at the merchandise stores, and meet your favorite movie characters here. You can even see different people dressed up as your favourite TV character.

WEBSITE

3. North Hollywood Recreation Center

This urban recreation center features sports fields and courts, an indoor gym, a playground, and an outdoor pool. Here, you can play basketball, badminton, baseball, tennis, softball, and more.

WEBSITE

Sports in North Hollywood

1. SoFi Stadium

Opened in 2020, the SoFi stadium serves as the home for the Los Angeles Rams and Los Angeles Chargers of the National Football League (NFL). Catch a game in this stadium/entertainment complex near North Hollywood and experience the vibrant energy this indoor stadium provides.

WEBSITE
TICKETS

2. Banc of California Stadium

Though this is a soccer-specific stadium, you can also catch other sporting events like rugby, lacrosse, and even boxing here. The best part is, you can watch your favorite sports while enjoying views of the Los Angeles skyline. This is definitely a great North Hollywood attraction.

WEBSITE

3. Rose Bowl Stadium

This historical landmark is also one of the most popular attractions near North Hollywood. Sports fans will not want to miss seeing an event in this high-profile arena that has over 92,000 seats!

WEBSITE
TICKETS

Cultural Attractions in Downtown Los Angeles

1. World of Illusions Los Angeles

Experience the thrill of 3D illusions and an Upside Down House (Stranger Things fans, it’s not what you think!) exhibit at this popular museum in North Hollywood. The paintings are very colorful, and you are sure to have a great, interactive experience.

WEBSITE
TICKETS

2. Hollywood Sign

How would you like to be in a place that you regularly see in movies? This cultural icon is one of Los Angeles’ best-known landmarks, and visiting the sign will truly give you the full Hollywood experience. There’s a 24-hour live webcam that captures the famous view, and you can visit by taking a hike or a shuttle bus.

WEBSITE

3. The Great Wall of Los Angeles

This beautiful wall features a mural that depicts the history of California up to the 1950s. This is one of the best places to visit while in North Hollywood, as it will pique your interest in important historical events.

WEBSITE
DIRECTIONS

Museums in North Hollywood

1. Los Angeles County Museum of Art

The Los Angeles County Museum of Art is a popular North Hollywood attraction that holds more than 150,000 works of art. You can even watch the museum’s featured film and concert series. It is the largest art museum in the Western United States and attracts many visitors annually.

WEBSITE
TICKETS

2. Autry Museum of the American West

This museum is located in a beautiful park and it is dedicated to the art, culture, and history of the American West. There’s so much you can find here, ranging from world-class galleries to film memorabilia.

WEBSITE
TICKETS

3. Hollywood Museum

Want to know more about the wonders of Hollywood? Well, this museum houses vast collections of costumes, props, photographs, scripts, and artifacts from the history of American television.

WEBSITE

Restaurants in North Hollywood

1. Spumante Restaurant

If you want to enjoy fine dining, Spumante is a great choice. This refined and elegant trattoria dishes up delicious, authentic Italian cuisine. You must try their ravioli and veal parmigiana.

WEBSITE

2. Rodini Park

This gorgeous Greek restaurant serves fresh Mediterranean food every day, including healthy and tender meats, perfectly grilled pitas, freshly baked desserts, gourmet sauces, and deliciously prepared dips.

WEBSITE

3. The Fat Dog

The Fat Dog is a gastropub that, according to their website, ‘offers delicious food, a creative and delicious craft cocktail program, a versatile wine list, and a truly excellent craft beer selection.’ If you’re dog lover, you’ll adore the decor of this pub, as they have pooch-themed digs and even a dog-friendly patio.

WEBSITE

4. BlaqHaus Noho

This casual restaurant in North Hollywood serves some of the best Southern meals. Their features include a Hookah bar, late-night dining, weekend brunch, and even karaoke nights. It’s the perfect spot to catch a quick bite with friends, making it one of the best places to visit in North Hollywood.

WEBSITE
